title: Code of Conduct
text: Members group friendly, considerate, respectful one another. Positive behaviors reinforce ideals include: considerate respectful Take responsibility words actions collaborative generous Value decisiveness, clarity consensus Ask help unsure Step considerately Acknowledging time effort

title: Code of Conduct
text: Every person community right appreciated . Regardless age, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, handicap, physical appearance, body size, ethnicity, nationality, race, religion (lack thereof), education, socio-economic status, community dedicated providing pleasant experience everyone. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying acceptable behavior standards expected respond instances unacceptable behavior appropriate equitable corrective action. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, issues, contributions adhere Code Conduct, well ban contributors temporarily permanently behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: project_package-vignette
text: goal projectPackage provide simplified functions achieve goal data preprocessing exploratory data analyses. projectPackage makes following steps quick easy: Removing certain columns data set Creating ggpairs correlation plot Creating recipe knn model document introduces tools mentioned well examples apply data frames use different real-world scenarios.

title: project_package-vignette
text: purpose demonstration, use basic data set called mtcars. data set 11 columns, 32 rows documented ?mtcars. Note mtcars data frame first 6 rows.

previous_headings: Demonstration of basic functions in projectPackage
title: project_package-vignette
text: Often work large data sets, columns redundant interest. case, can use function data_cleaning() drop columns. details use function, check help(data_cleaning). dropping single column mpg mtcars can see , column mpg dropped data frame. dropping multiple columns mtcars , columns mpg, disp, qsec dropped. inappropriate column name inputted, error occur. instance, accidentally used wrong column name mpf instead mpg. function kindly produce error. data_cleaning(data, "mpf") produce following message: “Error data_cleaning(data,”mpf“) : column name exist data frame”
code: head(data_cleaning(data, "mpg")) #>                   cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4           6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag       6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710          4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive      6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant             6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1 head(data_cleaning(data, c("mpg","disp","qsec"))) #>                   cyl  hp drat    wt vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4           6 110 3.90 2.620  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag       6 110 3.90 2.875  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710          4  93 3.85 2.320  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive      6 110 3.08 3.215  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout   8 175 3.15 3.440  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant             6 105 2.76 3.460  1  0    3    1

what: 2. Creating a ggpairs correlation plot using correlation_graph()
title: project_package-vignette
text: Often times visualizations needed better understand raw/modified data. Data visualization helps breakdown complex problems transforming data understandable format showing trends outliers. good visualization tells story reducing noise data emphasizing important facts. know GGally’s ggpairs() function can create correlation matrix us, however, plot can hard read lot data. Additionally, plot can look bit boring – lacking colour. correlation_graph() function solves problems us. details use function, check help(correlation_graph).
code: #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2

previous_headings: Demonstration of basic functions in projectPackage
what: 3. Creating a recipe for knn model using recipe_scale_center()
title: project_package-vignette
text: want make model, first create recipe specifying formula additional steps want perform; , often , want scale center data. recipe_scale_center() creates recipe also scales centers predictors given formula. example, can create recipe using mpg target hp cyl predictors.
code: recipe_scale_center(data, mpg ~ hp + cyl) #> Recipe #>  #> Inputs: #>  #>       role #variables #>    outcome          1 #>  predictor          2 #>  #> Operations: #>  #> Centering for recipes::all_predictors() #> Scaling for recipes::all_predictors()

title: Data Preprocessing for Exploratory Data Analysis
text: can install development version projectPackage Github like :

title: Data Preprocessing for Exploratory Data Analysis
text: Often work large data sets, columns redundant interest. can get monotonous writing seeing lines code across different projects, case, can use projectPackage::data_cleaning()drop columns. function differs select subsetin narrowed specific usage can useful learners wish work simpler straightforward functions. want create recipe, can easily accomplish using projectPackage::recipe_scale_center(). function scales centers predictor variables well building new model specification recipe analysis. Therefore, function saves tons time minimizes amount coding write. Lastly, want create ggpairs correlation matrix plot, package also covers ! However, function differs function ggpairs() adds additional aesthetics makes prettier readable.
code: library(projectPackage)  tidy_data <- data_cleaning(mtcars, c("drat","vs")) head(tidy_data) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp    wt  qsec am gear carb #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 2.620 16.46  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 2.875 17.02  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 2.320 18.61  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.215 19.44  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.440 17.02  0    3    2 #> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 3.460 20.22  0    3    1 recipe_scale_center(mtcars, mpg ~ hp) #> Recipe #>  #> Inputs: #>  #>       role #variables #>    outcome          1 #>  predictor          1 #>  #> Operations: #>  #> Centering for recipes::all_predictors() #> Scaling for recipes::all_predictors() correlation_graph(mtcars[1:3]) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2

what: Create a recipe to preprocess data — recipe_scale_center
title: Create a recipe to preprocess data — recipe_scale_center
text: Creates recipe scaling centering given data, creates model using given formula.

title: Create a recipe to preprocess data — recipe_scale_center
Create a recipe to preprocess data — recipe_scale_center
text: dataframe data frame tibble data. formula formula used create model (eg: target ~ predictor).

title: Create a recipe to preprocess data — recipe_scale_center
text: tidymodel recipe, specifying inputs, outputs, steps (scaling centering) applied predictors.

title: Create a recipe to preprocess data — recipe_scale_center
code: recipe_scale_center(mtcars, mpg ~ hp) #> Recipe #>  #> Inputs: #>  #>       role #variables #>    outcome          1 #>  predictor          1 #>  #> Operations: #>  #> Centering for recipes::all_predictors() #> Scaling for recipes::all_predictors() recipe_scale_center(mtcars, mpg ~ hp + cyl) #> Recipe #>  #> Inputs: #>  #>       role #variables #>    outcome          1 #>  predictor          2 #>  #> Operations: #>  #> Centering for recipes::all_predictors() #> Scaling for recipes::all_predictors() recipe_scale_center(mtcars, mpg ~ .) #> Recipe #>  #> Inputs: #>  #>       role #variables #>    outcome          1 #>  predictor         10 #>  #> Operations: #>  #> Centering for recipes::all_predictors() #> Scaling for recipes::all_predictors()
